events.name: Ukrainian forces prepare to hoist flag on Snake Island
events.wd_label: Ukrainian forces prepare to hoist flag on Snake Island
events.wd_description: Ukrainian forces are set to hoist the national flag on Snake Island after Russian troops withdrew, marking a significant moment in the ongoing conflict and strategic efforts to ease Moscow's embargo on Ukrainian ports.
events.description: Ukrainian forces are set to hoist the national flag on Snake Island after Russian troops withdrew, marking a significant moment in the ongoing conflict and strategic efforts to ease Moscow's embargo on Ukrainian ports.

events.name: Russian withdrawal
events.wd_description: Russian troops left Snake Island, citing a "gesture of goodwill" to not impede UN efforts for a humanitarian corridor.
events.description: Russian troops left Snake Island, citing a "gesture of goodwill" to not impede UN efforts for a humanitarian corridor.

events.name: Ukrainian preparations
events.wd_description: Ukrainian forces are preparing to hoist the national flag on Snake Island, though it remains unclear if they will maintain a long-term presence.
events.description: Ukrainian forces are preparing to hoist the national flag on Snake Island, though it remains unclear if they will maintain a long-term presence.

events.name: significance of Snake Island
events.wd_description: Control of Snake Island is viewed by Ukraine as a crucial first step in easing Moscow's embargo on its southern ports, despite the risk of bombing.
events.description: Control of Snake Island is viewed by Ukraine as a crucial first step in easing Moscow's embargo on its southern ports, despite the risk of bombing.

events.name: international attention
events.wd_description: Snake Island gained international attention when Russia originally took control in February, and multiple attempts have been made by Ukraine to recover it.
events.description: Snake Island gained international attention when Russia originally took control in February, and multiple attempts have been made by Ukraine to recover it.

events.name: Damage to Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant
events.wd_label: Damage to Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant
events.wd_description: The Ukrainian nuclear agency reported that part of the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant, controlled by Russia, was damaged by Russian rockets, though no radiation leak is suspected.
events.description: The Ukrainian nuclear agency reported that part of the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant, controlled by Russia, was damaged by Russian rockets, though no radiation leak is suspected.

events.name: Enerhoatom report
events.wd_description: Enerhoatom reported that a nitrogen-oxygen unit and a high-voltage power line at the Zaporizhzhia plant were damaged by Russian rockets.
events.description: Enerhoatom reported that a nitrogen-oxygen unit and a high-voltage power line at the Zaporizhzhia plant were damaged by Russian rockets.

events.name: Russian and Ukrainian blame
events.wd_description: Russian-appointed local officials blamed Ukraine for shelling, while Ukraine blamed Russian forces for launching rockets at civilian areas from the plant site.
events.description: Russian-appointed local officials blamed Ukraine for shelling, while Ukraine blamed Russian forces for launching rockets at civilian areas from the plant site.

events.name: plant control and operations
events.wd_description: Russia seized the Zaporizhzhia plant in March but kept Ukrainian employees to continue operations; the plant consists of six pressurized water reactors and stores radioactive waste.
events.description: Russia seized the Zaporizhzhia plant in March but kept Ukrainian employees to continue operations; the plant consists of six pressurized water reactors and stores radioactive waste.

events.name: UK defense ministry statement
events.wd_description: The UK's defense ministry stated that Russia has used the area around the Zaporizhzhia plant to minimize the risk of attack by Ukrainian forces due to its protected status.
events.description: The UK's defense ministry stated that Russia has used the area around the Zaporizhzhia plant to minimize the risk of attack by Ukrainian forces due to its protected status.

events.name: UN nuclear disarmament meeting fails due to Russia's refusal
events.wd_label: UN nuclear disarmament meeting fails due to Russia's refusal
events.wd_description: A UN meeting on nuclear disarmament failed after Russia refused to accept the final draft of the treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons, aimed at reducing nuclear risks and stopping the expansion of nuclear arsenals.
events.description: A UN meeting on nuclear disarmament failed after Russia refused to accept the final draft of the treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons, aimed at reducing nuclear risks and stopping the expansion of nuclear arsenals.

events.name: meeting failure
events.wd_description: The UN meeting on nuclear disarmament failed after Russia refused to accept the final draft of the treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons.
events.description: The UN meeting on nuclear disarmament failed after Russia refused to accept the final draft of the treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons.

events.name: treaty review
events.wd_description: The treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons is reviewed every five years as part of efforts to reduce nuclear risks and stop the expansion of nuclear arsenals.
events.description: The treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons is reviewed every five years as part of efforts to reduce nuclear risks and stop the expansion of nuclear arsenals.

events.name: Russia's attempts to amend treaty
events.wd_description: UN Ambassador Gustavo Zlauvinen stated that Russia attempted to amend the treaty, which would have caused chaos at this late stage in the negotiations.
events.description: UN Ambassador Gustavo Zlauvinen stated that Russia attempted to amend the treaty, which would have caused chaos at this late stage in the negotiations.

events.name: reactions to the failure
events.wd_description: Beatrice Fihn, the group's Executive Director, criticized the failure, stating that it is a total abdication of responsibility and noting that nuclear-armed states have spent over $82 billion on maintaining their arsenals without making progress on disarmament.
events.description: Beatrice Fihn, the group's Executive Director, criticized the failure, stating that it is a total abdication of responsibility and noting that nuclear-armed states have spent over $82 billion on maintaining their arsenals without making progress on disarmament.

events.name: Global EV battery supply chain requirements
events.wd_label: Global EV battery supply chain requirements
events.wd_description: To meet the demand for EV and energy storage batteries by 2035, the world needs to build almost 400 new mines for key battery components, according to Benchmark Minerals.
events.description: To meet the demand for EV and energy storage batteries by 2035, the world needs to build almost 400 new mines for key battery components, according to Benchmark Minerals.

events.name: increasing demand
events.wd_description: The need for lithium-ion batteries is expected to grow six times by 2032, driving significant demand for key raw materials.
events.description: The need for lithium-ion batteries is expected to grow six times by 2032, driving significant demand for key raw materials.

events.name: t: growth projections
events.wd_description: Benchmark predicts a sixfold increase in the need for lithium-ion batteries by 2032.
events.description: Benchmark predicts a sixfold increase in the need for lithium-ion batteries by 2032.

events.name: t: key materials
events.wd_description: Lithium-ion batteries require graphite, lithium, nickel, and cobalt, which are in limited supply.
events.description: Lithium-ion batteries require graphite, lithium, nickel, and cobalt, which are in limited supply.

events.name: new mines required
events.wd_description: Almost 400 new mines for lithium, graphite, nickel, and cobalt are needed by 2035 to meet battery demand, reducing slightly with recycling efforts.
events.description: Almost 400 new mines for lithium, graphite, nickel, and cobalt are needed by 2035 to meet battery demand, reducing slightly with recycling efforts.

events.name: t: lithium mines
events.wd_description: The world needs 74 new lithium mines, which can be reduced to 59 with recycling contributions.
events.description: The world needs 74 new lithium mines, which can be reduced to 59 with recycling contributions.

events.name: t: graphite mines
events.wd_description: 97 natural flake graphite mines are required by 2035, assuming no recycling contributions.
events.description: 97 natural flake graphite mines are required by 2035, assuming no recycling contributions.

events.name: t: nickel mines
events.wd_description: 72 new nickel mining projects are required by 2035.
events.description: 72 new nickel mining projects are required by 2035.

events.name: t: cobalt mines
events.wd_description: Without recycling, 62 new cobalt mining projects are needed by 2035.
events.description: Without recycling, 62 new cobalt mining projects are needed by 2035.

events.name: challenges and concerns
events.wd_description: Limited supplies of key materials and reliance on China for battery components pose geopolitical and ethical challenges.
events.description: Limited supplies of key materials and reliance on China for battery components pose geopolitical and ethical challenges.

events.name: t: China's dominance
events.wd_description: China controls the majority of the global lithium-ion battery supply chain, producing 80% of batteries and refining key materials.
events.description: China controls the majority of the global lithium-ion battery supply chain, producing 80% of batteries and refining key materials.

events.name: t: ethical concerns
events.wd_description: Ethical issues include alleged labor and human rights violations in China and environmental concerns in Chile and Argentina.
events.description: Ethical issues include alleged labor and human rights violations in China and environmental concerns in Chile and Argentina.

events.name: t: mining challenges
events.wd_description: Establishing new mines is time-consuming and subject to regulatory challenges, particularly in the US.
events.description: Establishing new mines is time-consuming and subject to regulatory challenges, particularly in the US.

events.name: innovative solutions
events.wd_description: Startups and new technologies are emerging to address battery supply chain challenges and improve sustainability.
events.description: Startups and new technologies are emerging to address battery supply chain challenges and improve sustainability.

events.name: t: Aceleron’s lithium batteries
events.wd_description: Aceleron produces lithium batteries designed to be easily upgraded and extended, enhancing their lifecycle.
events.description: Aceleron produces lithium batteries designed to be easily upgraded and extended, enhancing their lifecycle.

events.name: t: Tesla’s potential mining
events.wd_description: Tesla may enter the lithium mining and refining business due to high material costs.
events.description: Tesla may enter the lithium mining and refining business due to high material costs.
